description: The Confucius Institute of the University of Buenos Aires was inaugurated in 2009, being the first to be established in Argentina. It operates in cooperation with Jilin University, the Chinese International Education Foundation, and the Language Education and Cooperation Center.

University of Adelaide
description:
The Confucius Institute was officially launched in March 2007 by the then Federal Minister for Foreign Affairs the Hon. Alexander Downer.

2017 marked the 10th year anniversary of the establishment of the Confucius Institute at the University of Adelaide.

The establishment of the Confucius Institute with Shandong University consolidates longstanding ties with the University of Adelaide and coincides with the twentieth anniversary of the Sister State relationship between South Australia and Shandong Province.

patner institution: Charles Darwin University
description: The Confucius Institute is a partnership between Charles Darwin University, Anhui Normal University and Hainan University. Officially opened on 31 July 2012 to develop and deliver a range of programs to enhance awareness and understanding of the Chinese language and culture among the local community and foster Chinese and Australian cultural and economic links.

patner institution: Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology
Tourism Confucius Institute at Griffith University
description: The Tourism Confucius Institute at Griffith University was established in 2011 under an agreement between Griffith University, the Office of Chinese Language Council International in China and the China University of Mining and Technology.

patner institution: University of Queensland
description: The Confucius Institute at The University of Queensland was established in 2009 under an agreement between UQ and the Office of Chinese Language Council International (Hanban). At the heart of the agreement is our partnership with Tianjin University, one of the oldest and best universities in modern China.

patner institution: Queensland University of Technology
University of Melbourne
description: Confucius Institute at the University of Melbourne has a focus on corporate sector engagement and seeks to equip Victorians with the language and cultural skills necessary for building lasting relationships with Chinese stakeholders. Since the establishment, the Confucius Institute has provided services and training to a range of organisations, corporations and professionals.

patner institution: La Trobe University
University of Newcastle
description: Established in 2011, the Confucius Institute at the University of Newcastle is part of a wider global Confucius Institute Network within the education sector. Supported by our partner “Central China Normal University” in Wuhan, P.R. China, the Institute is dedicated to developing a range of initiatives to facilitate learning of Chinese language and culture.

patner institution: Victoria Business Confucius Institute
description:
VU and University of International Business and Economics' (UIBE) long-standing exchange partnership dates back to 2002. The institutes co-established VBCI on November 26, 2015 to facilitate cultural and business exchange between the two universities and the two countries.

The VBCI is the first business Confucius Institute in Victoria, and the ninth Confucius Institute of  UIBE. The VBCI brings a unique business focus that complements other Confucius Institutes in Melbourne.

The VBCI is based at VU’s Footscray Park Campus.

patner institution: the University of Sydney
description: The University of Sydney Confucius Institute was established in 2008 to cultivate a better understanding of Chinese culture in Australia. In the last 10 years we have focused on promoting Chinese language teaching and community outreach programs, including public lectures and cultural events that engage with China’s long history and cultural diversity from a variety of standpoints.

patner institution: University of Western Australia
description:
The Confucius Institute at The University of Western Australia teaches Chinese language and provides cultural training.

In 2005, it became the first Confucius Institute to be established in Australia.

patner institution: University of New South Wales
description: The Confucius Institute at UNSW was founded in 2007 as a joint venture between UNSW Australia and Shanghai Jiao Tong University.

description: The Shanto Mariam-Honghe Confucius Classroom was officially unveiled in Dhaka on November 22, with a ceremony attended by over 100 individuals. Among the distinguished guests were H.E. Mr. Yao Wen, Ambassador of China to Bangladesh, Dr. Md Nazrul Islam, Additional Foreign Secretary of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Bangladesh, Mr. Yue Liwen, Cultural Counsellor of the Chinese Embassy, Prof. Hong Bo, Chairman of Honhhe University Council, Prof. Mustafizul Hoque, Chairman of the Board of Trustees of Shanto Mariam University of Creative Technology, Prof. Md Shaa-e-Alam, Vice-Chancellor of SMUCT, as well as SMUCT faculty and individuals from Chinese enterprises in Bangladesh and the overseas Chinese community.

description: From its establishment on April 20, 2015, the CI has reflected the steadfast commitment of the campus to the mutual goals of educational cooperation as agreed in the Memorandum of Understanding of July 7, 2014 between the CI Headquarters and the Cave Hill Campus. description:
The Confucius Institute was established in Rome in 2006 thanks to the Department of the Italian Institute of Oriental Studies (ISO), in collaboration with the University of Foreign Languages ​​in Beijing (BFSU), and the support of the Hanban (National Office for Teaching of Chinese as a foreign language). It was the first Confucius Institute to be founded in Italy and the second in Europe, with the aim of promoting cultural exchanges between the two countries and organizing cultural activities, conferences, exhibitions and shows.

Training and refresher courses are held annually at the institute for teaching Chinese as a foreign language. The Confucius Institute also offers scholarships and study stays at leading Chinese universities.

It is also home to the international language proficiency exam HSK (Chinese Proficiency Test) and HSKK (HSK Speaking Test).
funder: Office of Chinese Language Council International/Chinese Ministry of Education

Confucius Institute at University of Malawi
description: On August 20, 2013, Hanban signed an agreement with the University of Malawi for the construction of a Confucius Institute on its campus. The Institute was inaugurated on August 12, 2016. On September 21, 2018, Chinese Ambassador Liu Hongyang was invited to attend the Confucius Institute Day celebration and the unveiling ceremony of a Confucius statue at the University of Malawi. Those present at the ceremony included: Malawi's Minister of Education represented Zinpita, Deputy Director-General of the Ministry of Culture Mpondamingo, Feng Jianguo, Chinese President of the Ma Dakong Academy, Chinese teachers, students of the Kong Academy, representatives of Chinese-funded enterprises in Malawi, and overseas Chinese.

Confucius Institute at the University of Aberdeen
description: The Confucius Institute of the University of Aberdeen, established 27th September 2013, provides Chinese language teaching and culture classes and cultural events to the North East Scotland community, including University staff and students, schools, business and industry, and community organisations and individuals.

patner institution: Confucius Classroom in Kingsford community school
Confucius Institute for Scotland in the University of Edinburgh
description: The Confucius Institute for Scotland in the University of Edinburgh is a national centre promoting educational and cultural ties between Scotland and China. Set up with Sino-Scottish Government backing and partnered with Fudan University the institute was established in 2006, the first in Scotland.

patner institution: Confucius Institute for Northern Ireland at Ulster University
description: The Confucius Institute at the Ulster University (CIUU) was established in 2011 to develop academic, cultural, economic and social ties between Northern Ireland and China.

patner institution: Confucius Institute at De Montfort University
description: The Confucius Institute at De Montfort University (DMU CI) is a vibrant celebration of Chinese language and culture, providing an insight for students, staff and the wider community. It was co-founded by the University of Science and Technology in Beijing (USTB), the Chinese partner university of DMU CI.

patner institution: Confucius Institute at Bangor University
description: The inception of the Confucius Institute at Bangor University took place in September 2012, contributing to a vast network of more than 500 similar institutions globally. In the United Kingdom, there are presently 30 Confucius Institutes, with three of them located at distinguished Welsh universities - Bangor, Cardiff, and the University of Wales Trinity St. David.

patner institution: Confucius Institute at the University of Glasgow
description: Founded in 2011, the Confucius Institute at the University of Glasgow is an educational and cultural exchange partnership with Nankai University, receiving support from the Centre for Language Education and Cooperation (CLEC).

patner institution: Confucius Institute of Science and Technology Innovation at the University of Huddersfield
Confucius Institute at The University of Hull
Confucius Institute at Coventry University
description: The Confucius Institute at Coventry University (CICU) was established in 2016 as a collaboration between Coventry University and Jiangxi University of Finance and Economics - a renowned Chinese institution ranked 7th among universities specialising in finance and economics in China.The Confucius Institute at Coventry University (CICU) was established in 2016 as a collaboration between Coventry University and Jiangxi University of Finance and Economics - a renowned Chinese institution ranked 7th among universities specialising in finance and economics in China.

patner institution: Confucius Institute at Cardiff University
Confucius Institute at Lancaster University
description:
Our Confucius Institute is a regional and national leader in bridging China and Great Britain, a centre for immersion in Mandarin language, culture, research, teaching and collaboration.

The Institute opened on 20th December 2011, a partnership between Lancaster University and South China University of Technology in Guangzhou.

patner institution: Confucius Institute at the University of Central Lancashire
description: The UCLan Confucius Institute was launched at the University of Central Lancashire in 2008. We are partnered with Beijing International Studies University, authorized by Chinese International Education Foundation, and supported by the Centre for Language Education and Cooperation.

patner institution: Confucius Institute at University of Liverpool
description: Beginning in 2009, the Liverpool Confucius Institute (LCI) is a collaborative project between the University of Liverpool (UoL), Xi'an Jiaotong University (XJTU) and the Chinese International Education Foundation. The LCI is committed to working with UoL, XJTU, local Liverpool and Merseyside councils, cultural organisations, schools and the public for the promotion of Chinese language and culture.

patner institution: Business Confucius Institute at the University of Leeds
description: The Business Confucius Institute is a partnership between the University of Leeds and the University of International Business and Economics, authorised by The Chinese International Education Foundation (CIEF) and supported by The Centre for Language Education and Cooperation (CLEC).

patner institution: Confucius Institute for Dance and Performance at Goldsmiths, University of London
description: Goldsmiths Confucius Institute for Dance and Performance was founded in summer 2012 as a collaboration between Goldsmiths, Beijing Dance Academy and Chinese Language Education Centre (formerly named Hanban or Confucius Institute Headquarters).

patner institution: Confucius Institute at UCL IOE
Confucius Institute for Business, London/ Confucius Institute for Business LSE , London
description: The Confucius Institute for Business London (CIBL) is a non-profit educational partnership between LSE and Tsinghua University. It was launched in 2006 with five sponsoring companies: HSBC, BP, Deloitte, Swire and Standard Chartered. Specialising in business communication, CIBL helps London business communities to learn Mandarin and to develop their understanding of business cultures in China.

patner institution: Confucius Institute at Queen Mary University of London
description: The Queen Mary Confucius Institute, a collaboration between Queen Mary University of London and Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications (BUPT), aims to expand global opportunities for students, staff and the local communities of each university, by strengthening educational exchanges, teaching Mandarin Chinese language, assessing Chinese language proficiency, and by developing inter-cultural awareness through hosting Chinese cultural events.

patner institution: Confucius Institute for Traditional Chinese Medicine, London
description: CITCM was founded in 2007, and since then, we have received many awards including the Confucius Institute of the Year Award (2009, 2010, 2011, 2012 and 2013) and Model Confucius Institute status (2014).

patner institution: Confucius Institute at the University of Manchester
description:
The Institute received its approval in July 2005 and was formally launched in October 2006.

A partnership between The University of Manchester, the Center for Language Education and Cooperation (CLEC) and Beijing Normal University, Manchester is the proud home to the second Confucius Institute to be established in the UK.

patner institution: Confucius Institute at the University of Southampton
description: The University of Southampton Confucius Institute (CI) was formally opened in October 2011 in collaboration with our Chinese partners at Xiamen University, P.R. China. Since that date we have been working on a series of workshops and events to raise the profile of the Confucius Institute at the University and amongst the local community.

patner institution: University of Oxford China Centre
description: The University of Oxford China Centre was launched in May 2008. It joins together academics from across the whole University, co-ordinating activities in all areas of study of China, with OSGA's Contemporary China Studies serving as a key stakeholder and partner.

patner institution: Confucius Classroom at Oxford Brooks University
description: A non-profit collaboration, the Confucius Institute at Oxford Brookes University (CIOBU) is the first Confucius Institute in the world co-established by a university and a publishing company in China (Foreign Language Teaching and Research Press). Publishing is the specialist focus of CIOBU, making CIOBU a unique presence among all the Confucius Institutes around the globe. In April 2016, CIOBU officially opened its doors and began working toward promoting Chinese language and culture, as well as offering publishing-related activities. CIOBU commits to aiding co-operation between Chinese and UK publishing whilst encouraging Chinese Language Teaching (CLT) or China-related publications.

patner institution: Confucius Institute in Newcastle
Confucius Institute at the University of Nottingham
description: Established in 2007, the Nottingham Confucius Institute at the University of Nottingham is a partnership between The University of Nottingham, Chinese International Education Foundation (CIEF) and Fudan University. Its principal remit is to develop and enhance educational, economic and cultural links between the UK and China.

patner institution: Scottish Confucius Institute for Business and Communication
Confucius Institute at the University of Wales Trinity Saint David
Confucius Institute for Scotland’s Schools
description: Launched in June 2012, the Confucius Institute for Scotland’s Schools (CISS) is the first government initiated Confucius Institute in the UK, jointly established by the University of Strathclyde, Scotland’s National Centre for Languages and the Tianjin Municipal Education Commission.

description: In the Chinese immersion programs, the pioneer group of students is now transitioning into high school as 9th grade students. In order to sustain the students’ interest and motivation in immersion classes, a Capstone Learning Abroad Experience to China was integrated into the strategic planning of the program.

patner institution: Confucius Classroom in Oyster River School District
Confucius Classroom at St. Mary’s School
description: Established in June of 2008, St. Mary's School was the first Confucius Classroom established in North or South America. As a Confucius Classroom, students and community members have unprecedented access to Chinese language studies, travel to China, and friendship-building opportunities with Chinese students, teachers, and professors.
